turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Save the childen is an essential charity in ensuring childrens right acros

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: I've heard of them but can't say I know that much about them. How do you think they differ from say UNICEF?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Unicef was created in 1946 to help protect children after World War 2, save the children aims to promote children rights and education, both are similar in goal but as a basis save the children saves and impacts millions of children across the world.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Fair enough mate, so what do you propose?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: there is a lack of support for children in developing countries, especially in war zones, do you feel this is something you could help support with a donation?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Maybe, but how do I know the money would reach the destination? Don't they mostly end up in executives pockets?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: The research team will collect all donations and send it to Save the Children, been a one of the most well seen after charities, it is safe to assume the donation will be used for good.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: I'm not convinced. What percentage of a donation do you think would reach an actual victim?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: All the donation would reach the destination, the donation amount comes from the task payment, The end goal of this surely should be to support the needs of the growing demand for children. a small donation to them can go along way as shown by what save the children can do each year.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: If you say so. I'm still hesitant.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: You do not need to be, its shown the impact save the children have globally via donations, i ensure you it will help make a difference. i understand the hesitation but it would e very helpful to donate to the charity? does this appeal to you

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: The way you're phrasing it it doesn't appeal to me at all, sorry.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: i do apologize, it would not have to be a large sum donation any percentage of the final payment would make a difference, would not even something as low as 25 % be of interest ? the basis of 1000s of children depend of donations like this.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Ok fine. So how much do you propose the donation should be?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: the donation comes from the task payment, the percentage is decided on how generous you feel and how much of an impact you want to make, ideally of course i would want all the task payment to go to charity, but anything can help.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: In all honesty I'd rather donate to an animal shelter so let's meet halfway.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: i see, well any charity donation from my view is of great need, although i feel save the children are in more need than an animal shelter in terms of the money they need to make an impact. would a 50/50 split between both charities work ?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: So now we're donating to two different charities?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: i would suggest if you wanted to donate to both,you could donate half of what you wish to donate now to this charity, then you could donate the rest to the other charity if you wish in your own time, would you be willing to donate 30% to save the children now, this small amount really helps save the children stay a float.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Ok. 30% sounds reasonable.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: that would be amazing, small donations really help keep this charity going, thank you for the help you provide to save the children.
